com.mobixell.xtt
Class FunctionModule_Radius

java.lang.Object
  com.mobixell.xtt.FunctionModule
      com.mobixell.xtt.FunctionModule_Radius
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Object>
public class FunctionModule_Radius
extends FunctionModule

FunctionModule_Radius provides functions for Radius Logon and Radius Logoff. It uses the radclient3.jar radius3 class api from theorem.com

Version:
$Id: FunctionModule_Radius.java,v 1.15 2010/05/05 08:12:37 rajesh Exp $
Author:
Roger Soder
See Also:
Radius3

initialize

public void initialize()
Constructor initializes the communitcation to the RadiusServer. Prints out a warning if it can not create the RADIUSClient object. Does not fail however because you ma not be using radius.

newSessionId

public void newSessionId(String[] parameters)
creates a new sessionId for Radius

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument and following are not used. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

radiusLogon

public void radiusLogon(String[] parameters)
does the Logon by sending the radius information over the network to the RadiusServer.

Calls the private method doRadius which uses the RADIUSClient object of the Radius3 package. If the RADIUSClient was not initialized the method fails.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the userId, parameters[2] is the user phone number and the optional parameters[3] is the users ipAddress. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
Radius3

radiusLogoff

public void radiusLogoff(String[] parameters)
does the Logon by sending the radius information over the network to the RadiusServer.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters.
